page.title: 03Pulloxhill Parish Council
page.content: Pulloxhill Parish Council "The vital function of Parish Councils is to voice "grass-roots" opinion within local government" Pulloxhill Parish Council comprises 7 members, elected by popular ballot every 4 years. It elects a Chairman and Vice Chairman internally. It employs a part-time Clerk for routine administration. The Council's function is mainly advisory, with very little executive power. The County and District Councils consult its opinion on many matters, the commonest being planning. The Council's direct responsibilities are streetlighting and grasscutting; it maintains The Shelter,a small building owned by the Parish; provides a Recreation Ground and elects one school governor.
